PageTitle: peer ip-prefix export (BGP multi-instance VPN instance IPv4 address family view) (group)
FuncDef:
The peer ip-prefix export command configures a policy based on an IP prefix list for filtering BGP routes to be advertised to a specified peer group.
The undo peer ip-prefix export command cancels this configuration. The peer ip-prefix export command configures a policy based on an IP prefix list for filtering BGP routes to be advertised to a specified peer group. The undo peer ip-prefix export command cancels this configuration. By default, no route filtering policy based on an IP address prefix list is configured for a peer group.
ParentView: BGP multi-instance VPN instance IPv4 address family view

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a peer group.
The value is a string of 1 to 47 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.  The character string can contain spaces if it is enclosed with double quotation marks (").

Specifies the name of an IP prefix list.
The name is a string of 1 to 169 case-sensitive characters, with spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Applies a filtering policy to the routes to be advertised to a peer group.
-

Examples: [~HUAWEI] ip ip-prefix prefix1 permit 10.1.1.1 8 greater-equal 17 less-equal 18
ExtraInfo: The peer ip-prefix export command can be used to configure a route filtering policy that is based on an IP prefix list for filtering BGP routes to be advertised to a specified peer group, implementing route control.
